passage: Public-awareness campaigns about the need to reduce single-use plastics can be successful, says researcher Kim Borg of Monash University in Australia, when these campaigns give consumers a choice: for example, Japan achieved a 40 percent reduction in plastic-bag use after cashiers were instructed to ask customers whether ______ blank wanted a bag.
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.A: Choice A is the best answer. The convention being tested is pronoun–antecedent agreement. The plural pronoun "they" agrees in number with the plural antecedent "customers."
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect because the singular pronoun "one" doesn't agree in number with the plural antecedent "customers."
answer_rationales.C: Choice C is incorrect because the second person pronoun "you" isn't conventional as a substitute for "customers." It suggests that the audience ("you") is the customer.
answer_rationales.D: Choice D is incorrect because the singular pronoun "it" doesn't agree in number with the plural antecedent "customers."
